website_summaries.verdict: Reasonable price point for an epoxy resin coating.
pros: Easy to mix with a 1:1 ratio
Delivers a crystal-clear finish that also resists any yellowing when exposed to the elements
Has UV resistance built into it
Cures more quickly than some other epoxy resins
cons: Occasionally leaves bubbles behind after it sets

customer_reviews.title: A smooth, flawless surface with a brilliant shine!
customer_reviews.text: After working with several types of epoxy resin, this has honestly got to be the best so far. The quality of the finished product is superb. Minimal bubbles, smooth surface, and a brilliant shine. Great value for such a great product !
customer_reviews.author: LISA P

customer_reviews.title: Amazing and easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use with great results. I made a wood countertop painted it black and I thought for sure I would see the wood gran after application but not the case at all epoxy fills in all scratch/ gran marks. Smooth as glass and looks like marble. You can buy marble effects spray paint on amazon as well.
customer_reviews.author: inking

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use. Crystal clear.
customer_reviews.text: Used it for a jewelry project and was surprised how easy it was to use. This is the first time ive ever used resin so i dont have much to compare to but i love how the jewelry turned out and the fact that its super clear.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley mccampbell

customer_reviews.title: Great!! Very hard
customer_reviews.text: Doesn’t stain as easily as other epoxy. Does well with hot heat. It can stain but only with specific items
customer_reviews.author: Arts

customer_reviews.title: Just as good as the expensive stuff
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used epoxy that costs twice as much and I honestly like this better. It smooths it self out and hardens better than other brands I’ve tried. I just ordered more to do one more layer on the top of this table, and it is the only epoxy I will use now.
customer_reviews.author: Dirty sanchez

customer_reviews.title: This stuff far exceeded my wildest expectations.
customer_reviews.text: I used this to make a penny countertop for my teardrop trailer project. This stuff is almost too easy to put on. Follow the direction, stir it well for a continuous 3-4 minutes, pour it on, use a putty knife to pull epoxy over surface, use a blow drier to pop the microscopic bubbles, and wait. It self leveled and provided a flawless, glossy, level surface. I lather/rinsed/repeated 3times to get a good 1/4 inch thick surface. I purchased some cheap, disposable plastic tubs and a wooden paint stick. Cleanup was a breeze. Just throw bucket and stick away. I would highly recommend this stuff for this type of bartop/countertop project.
customer_reviews.author: geocruzer

customer_reviews.title: Ruined my workbenches and left me with a giant mess
customer_reviews.text: This product only cured halfway for me, leaving behind a giant tacky mess that I have no idea what to do with. The ambient temperature was 60°, the product was warm before application, and I mixed/applied it quickly to my freshly sanded/ cleaned workbenches. After waiting hours, days, and then a week I realized this epoxy was not going to cure. It is sticky like molasses and has rendered all of my workspace unusable. I wish I had never ordered this product because now I am significantly worse off.
customer_reviews.author: Saraea

customer_reviews.title: Very good with metallic powders!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have a YouTube channel called GoodView Woodworks where I use Epoxy and wood together all the time and I really liked using this Epoxy!! It is easy to use and is a little thicker than the other countertop epoxies that I have tried. It suspends the metallic pigment longer because of the thickness. The price point is great as well. Will definitely recommend!!!
customer_reviews.author: GoodView Woodworks

customer_reviews.title: It’s not “crystal clear”, it’s YELLOW!
customer_reviews.text: This product is crap. The curing agent bottles have been different colors. The tint after mixed is yellow, not crystal clear. This product changed my blue river table to green.
customer_reviews.author: SG

customer_reviews.title: Cured hard but had issues
customer_reviews.text: I am a proffesional furniture maker and Followed directions to the T and still had issues. Temp was steady 77 as was product, mixed very thoroughly and had issues with bubbles. Wood was also sealed beforehand)Even with a torch they kept completely nh and the top dried so quick they bubbles couldn't pop. Also seemed too thick to self level well. Rolling it over the edges left very uneven surface with drips.
customer_reviews.author: Maulana Sayyidi

customer_reviews.title: Great price, great instructions, great product.
customer_reviews.text: This product took this beginner to the next level. I followed the directions on 7 separate pours and came out with 7 fantastic pours on a live edge Cherry coffee table. Which is impressive considering this is the first time I’ve ever worked with epoxy resin! Incredible Solutions is Great for the beginner and great for the professional. Thank you Incredible Solutions.
customer_reviews.author: ellie

customer_reviews.title: Created thousands of microscopic, hard to pop,, bubbles
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the worst epoxy I have EVER used. It said that it would cast up to 1/4” at a time and then when I got the bottles in the mail and read on the description, it clearly states NOT TO BE USED AS A CAST RESIN. PRIMARILY USED FOR TOP COATS. so with that said, this epoxy makes so many microscopic bubbles, it near impossible to get rid of them all. Definitely will not buy this product again.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Make sure it’s more than enough to cover the area you plan on doing. I ran out and end up having gaps left. But that was my fault. Product itself worked great
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: WASTE OF MONEY  CANNOT RETURN
customer_reviews.text: I am not new to epoxy I did everything on their recommendations and I first time tried added Pinata alcohol inks the thing started bubbling smoking and left pot holes as in video and pic. This stuff cures so fast you cannot even get bubbles out. I have tried on 3 different days different weather, differnet projects even just a clear pour and it NOT clear and full of tiny bubbles!!! Try to put heat to bubbles and it hardens fast super fast. WASTE of MONEY cannot find link to contact company and Amazon says NO RETURNS. NEVER AGAIN!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Seems to do what it suppose to but...
customer_reviews.text: I wish I could pour my epoxy in the perfect environment that it requests. Unfortunately, that is not the real world. Even though I couldn't keep my shop to the 75 degrees that it requested, the epoxy did dry on both pours completely. I did have problems with the second pour actually self leveling. Not sure if the first pour was too roughly sanded or what. Even the heat wouldn't level it out completely. But epoxy, regardless of brand, can be finicky and submissive to so many environmental variables. The product does what it says it will do. I would use again... Seems to be a good value.
customer_reviews.author: boydumber

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: First time user. Used over oil based stain that had cured for 6 days in 75degree low humidity. First coat used a torch to remove air bubbles. Really didn’t need a second coat but wanted more depth. Applied second coat after about 3 hours. End result is beyond my expectations. No flaws, no air bubbles. Will definitely use this again.
customer_reviews.author: AlwaysFord

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Resin!!!
customer_reviews.text: My partner and I love this product! This is our second of many purchases. We're using it for small pieces like jewelry and key chains. The product itself is really easy to use, the end result is clear and with a beautiful shine. This is highly recommended!! :)
customer_reviews.author: WingID_Lust

customer_reviews.title: Works wonders/ goes far
customer_reviews.text: As you see my tools and product , i had been worried that it wasn't enough i was wrong plenty! Bad flooring cleaned cleaned cleaned still stained since i was using a gold flake i was good to go after first poor it looks more yellow in pics but real time its gold and speckled i plan a sanding and second poor with a lite very lite rust flakes in it since i am doing the hall all the way into bed room(icicle sparkles) and kitchen (copper penny sparkles) way good product and cleanup was a breeze! Thanks
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I was looking for. Something clear and hard.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. Mixed perfectly in a graduated bucket with a wood shim because that's what I had laying around. Make sure to use some latex gloves, cover the floor well and be sure to level the project before pouring. Also invest in or borrow a heat gun it's critical to getting a bubble free finish. Oh and some tweezers to put hairs and other surface trash. I let mine cure for 48hrs before using it. It looks incredible.
customer_reviews.author: Ian

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Company and Product!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely one of the coolest companies I have ever done business with! I refinished a dinning room table and was curious on MY mistake and what to.do next. I sent them an email, they responded immediately and then had a tech call me at 6:00 at night. The product is awesome and looks amazing. Have patients and go slow and it will create a finish that last forever! Thanks again for the help and for being SO responsive and backing your product! If I could give them 100 stars, I would!
customer_reviews.author: FFaircloth

customer_reviews.title: NOT A CASTING RESIN
customer_reviews.text: ATTENTION do not buy this to use as a casting resin! Ive used other brands to make ashtrays, coasters, etc. and just assumed this one would work just as well but after I poured my mold and waited 24 hrs it hadn’t hardened in the slightest.. then I read the bottle and it said only use as top coat. On the other hand, mixing was super smooth, no bubbles and super clear. I’ll still use this for pieces that just need a top coat, but again, this isn’t for molds!
customer_reviews.author: Jessie

customer_reviews.title: Low oder, great coverage, rapid curing time
customer_reviews.text: I was very impressed with my first application with the Incredible Solutions Table Top Epoxy. I used it over an acrylic dirty pour on canvas. I was pleased that there was no shrinkage, pulling or fish eyes with the resin - not to mention very low oder. A sample of my use of it is on YouTube - Designed By Kathy. I look forward to using in my next project on wood. UPDATE: I just finished this serving board. After putting my design on it, I added my coat of resin. It cured so beautiful. NO bubbles - a nice glass-like finish.
customer_reviews.author: katlyn

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use resin
customer_reviews.text: Great epoxy resin, would highly recommend. I'm a crafter and just began working with resin for custom gifts. Product arrived quickly, was very well packaged, had clear easy to follow instructions, and was a great value.
customer_reviews.author: Renee 511

customer_reviews.title: Great product!  very clear, durable finish.
customer_reviews.text: Great product, very clear, and simple (but I wouldn't call it easy) to use. Mixing is a simple 1:1 ratio, and must be done thoroughly. Success is all in the preparation as per the instructions. My mistake was taking on a large involved project with no experience, but when I did have a problem, Charlie walked me through the repair, and it came out great!! I've gotten loads of compliments on our new bar.
customer_reviews.author: Brian M.

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed.
customer_reviews.text: Easy enough instructions, 1:1 ratio, mix for 5 minutes, pour seal coat, pour flood coat. Simple enough but ruined a counter top I had been working on for days. Not my first time working with epoxy but this was the first time with this particular brand. Did not bond well with the pine and had to sand the whole thing down and pour again. What a mess. I poured the counter tops in my garage with a torpedo heater on as i always do, followed instructions to a T and still not the results i could sale to a customer. 2 gallons and a whole day wasted.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Hill

customer_reviews.title: What I was looking dor
customer_reviews.text: Holy crap yall. This stuff is amazing so far!! Easy to mix, easy to pour. Covered my ugly yellow countertops in marble contact paper and needed to seal them in order to use them. Just did it tonight, will see how it feels after it has cured for the minimum 24 hrs.
customer_reviews.author: Norizzle

customer_reviews.title: Not for casting
customer_reviews.text: Before I ordered this brand,never used it before,I read everything on the description page. It all looked great,from the description page. I've used it about 3 times now. I won't be purchasing this brand again. I do castings, this is NOT for castings. It doesn't say that anywhere on the description page,but it does say it on the bottles of resin. Had I known this,I would NEVER have bought this. Do NOT use for casting, even thin castings like I do,you'll never get all the bubbles out before it sets. I've tried it on my shallow,silicone molds. Too many bubbles.
customer_reviews.author: mark b.

customer_reviews.title: Stuck and disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: I was very disappointed. The product was a good value. The product I started my project with seemed to be unavailable for the original, comparable price so I tried this. It's still curing (8hrs) but is cloudy, making the beautiful colors, glimmer and patterns below. I just used this as the top coat.l, so I'm stuck and disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: lenard t franklin

customer_reviews.title: Best Product on the market!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this epoxy for my husband for a countertop bar he is building. We absolutely love the finish! This product is very clear and highly recommend this top notch epoxy product! I will absolutely purchase this again in the future. The package arrived on time and very neatly packaged.
customer_reviews.author: Whitney

customer_reviews.title: This is a perfect finish for rock painting! Lasts forever!
customer_reviews.text: I use this for my rock art. It works great for painted rocks for garden paths, although you may want to anti-skid it somehow I haven’t figured that out yet. So am using the rocks for garden art and sealing it with this epoxy. I absolutely love it! Make sure you mix it exactly 1/2 and 1/2. I use red mini solo cups to measure. Stir until it clears and you are good to go! Make sure temp is 75-80 degrees if possible. It dries fastest in heat. If you do it below 70 degrees it will dry but takes forever! And I had no trouble with any bubbles. After pouring over rocks they disappear. Have fun!
customer_reviews.author: Kristina Smith

customer_reviews.title: Measure Very Carefully
customer_reviews.text: Pay very close attention to your measuring. I did one countertop using another resin that was thick as heck and hard to move but yhe counter came out beautiful. I used this table top epoxy to do the other 2 counters and it wouldn't dry. I looked at the bottles a few days later and 3 quarters of the curing agent was gone but virtually all of the resin was still in the bottle. I used a measuring cup too. How does that happen. Pour the curing agent first.
customer_reviews.author: anita williams

customer_reviews.title: Inconsistent and wavy
customer_reviews.text: Reason why I’m giving a one star is because the epox was very thick and inconsistent it made my carbon fiber work come out very wavy In spots I did a lot of layers I tried the boiling water surrounding cup method to one make the Apoxsee easier to work with and less thick and two to get rid of the bubbles it did come out very clear however the wave in this an inconsistency of it is why I’m going to have to give it a bad review
customer_reviews.author: LTM22

customer_reviews.title: Great Epoxy
customer_reviews.text: This Table Top epoxy is a great product. I have had great results with using it clear, or tinted. Tints are easy to mix and hold color well. The 50/50 mixture is easy to measure and mix. The resin is affected by the cold and seems thicker in cold (thesis Florida so cold is 60) weather. I recommend heating both resonant harder to 70 to 80 F before mixing.
customer_reviews.author: Reginal A. Hay Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Great Stuff
customer_reviews.text: Used this for a kitchen counter project. Followed the instructional video to mix the product and I couldn’t be happier with the result. Read A LOT of reviews and watched lots of videos and this product for me is the most reliable for the most reasonable price. I’d buy it again. Btw, I used the Giani White Diamond Countertop Kit to achieve the limestone look. Good luck on your projects!
customer_reviews.author: TFran

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, worked great
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to try out on a table for work. I mixed the full gallon to pour over the main part of the table that I had put stickers on and framed around with 2x4’s. The table was recessed about 1/8”-1/4” all around. It measured 2x5 and there was just enough to fill it to the top edges. After mixing I spent about a half hour to 45 minutes off an on with a heat gun going over it to raise and pop any air bubbles. Just follow the directions and you shouldn’t have any issues. Can’t wait to try it on something else.
customer_reviews.author: Brianbac3

customer_reviews.title: Much better option than buying a new table.
customer_reviews.text: Why did I wait this long to improve my table? This epoxy is really easy to use and gave a very good result- my outdoor table got so disintegrated that I could no longer use it to ear anything near due to dust from the cement surface- All I had to do is wait for nice sunny day above 75 degree and mixed two bottles and spread it with a wide brush. It is almost self leveling but some areas will be thicker it is not completely leveled. I really love the way it turn out- I know it will turn yellowish eventually but no more dust issue.
customer_reviews.author: W. S. Yoon

customer_reviews.title: Looks good. Easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: I finally got around to making a penny table. The epoxy was easy to mix and use. Make sure you have a heat gun and a solid 30-45 min to watch for bubbles and hit with the heat gun. Even if no bubbles are there when you pour they will still spontaneously appear. Overall it was about as simple as it could be. Just don’t get this stuff on your skin or your dog because it’s a pain to get it off once it’s cured 😂
customer_reviews.author: David Volk

customer_reviews.title: Hard to eliminate bubbles
customer_reviews.text: Cons: this resin is very thick - so it's hard not to mix in a lot of air bubbles, that are impossible to eliminate. Tried to mix it with a drill and by hand - both methods resulted in a huge amount of bubbles. It's not like with other, more fluid, resins: bubble will not come out by itself - you need to blow or torch it out. And the instruction says just that. The problem is some of the bubbles are tiny and only seen on a bright sun that is not present where I'm working. Pros: this resin is very clear
customer_reviews.author: Kateryna

customer_reviews.title: Best Yet
customer_reviews.text: I love this Epoxy. Although all resins will scratch some this one in particular seems a bit more resistant. My new go to. Thank you 🙂 I’m one happy artist.
customer_reviews.author: Mich

customer_reviews.title: Great price
customer_reviews.text: I do a lot of acrylic pours and I love to coat them with resin. I’ve tried three different brands of resin and this one is my 2nd favorite. My number one pick is super expensive, so this brand has definitely been great! Easy to mix, levels great and I love the results!
customer_reviews.author: Steven W. Finckbeiner

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Product!!!
customer_reviews.text: Love, love LOVE this EPOXY SET! Not only is it beginners friendly but the price was AWESOME!!!! After reading reviews and not knowing what type of Resin to start off with I’m glad I took a chance and got this. I made sure to properly prep, wear protective gear and read all of the instructions thoroughly. The first attempt took about 24 hours to fully cure (large tray) and my most recent project took only 5 hours to cure (small coasters) When I tell you I’ve found a new hobby I’m not joking. I’m so glad I discovered this brand! Can’t wait to make more art!
customer_reviews.author: Crystal Street

customer_reviews.title: If you are thinking about it..just get it!! Worth the money!!
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to use and at a 1:1 ratio it is very hard to get the measurements messed up...I poured mine when it was a little cooler than the recommended temperature and I saw no terrible flaws other than took a little bit longer to cure and those dango skeeters and whatever else got in with wings...other than that I love the final product and for the first time doing this big of a pour(over inch thick)very satisfied!!
customer_reviews.author: Lalita

customer_reviews.title: Too many bubbles
customer_reviews.text: I do not recommend for arts abs crafts. Creates soooo many bubbles that won't go away. The cure time is very quick so you have limited time to work on your project before the resin becomes unpourable. It is also not crystal clear. I have been working with resin for a few years now and I decided to try a cheaper resin...I wonf use this one again. I do like that I don't have to wait a full 24 hours to demold my coasters. If only it didn't create bubbles and was clear =[
customer_reviews.author: Erica

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy this product!!!
customer_reviews.text: Horrible product! Doesn’t firm up and stays sticky. I wouldn’t have given it 1 star. Complete waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Jenna27k

customer_reviews.title: High Quality Product but give it a few days longer to set
customer_reviews.text: I am really pleased with the results but I would suggest waiting a few days longer than you think to begin placing anything on top of the surface. Some people say to do a "thumb nail" test by putting hard pressure with your thumbnail on the surface to check for solidity. I wouldn't trust that even if you are certain you have the ratio down to a science. Wait a day or two longer rather than mess up your project. It mixes nicely with powdered pigment. I would also not skimp on the drop cloths. I would suggest doing a small sample/test of your project before doing you final pour.
customer_reviews.author: Imma Shoppin

customer_reviews.title: Super helpful staff and great product
customer_reviews.text: I covered a custom pallet wood bar top with this product. It took a couple of coats (apply it thin in multiple coats for best results) to build up to the level I needed and air bubbles from the wood was a battle but the product worked well and the folks at Incredible Solutions were extremely helpful with several questions that I had. If I do another epoxy project I would use this again.
customer_reviews.author: Terry Lowe

customer_reviews.title: Counters yellow
customer_reviews.text: I used this to cover my counter tops after painting them white. At first it looked great, clear and shiny. After three months, they are now yellowing. It’s getting worse and worse. I would not use this over anything white. Otherwise its a good product.
customer_reviews.author: eliza daves

customer_reviews.title: Price,Quality, Easy-to-use,Great end Results
customer_reviews.text: What easy to use, end result looks amazing and if you have any questions or concerns seller is quick and responsive with communication. I wouldn't hesitate to purchase more, actually I recently placed an order for more, nothing but time in 2020 while we are sequestered in our homes, so might as while pass the time being creative, if your on the fence on which epoxy to purchase go for it, works great and has simple instructions to follow, and a bonus it a product of the USA. Hopefully this will help in your decision making process.
customer_reviews.author: Mike the Barber

customer_reviews.title: Eh,
customer_reviews.text: Don't believe this stuff as it says to never use more than 1/4" at a time. I've found with this stuff some reason. It gets harder when you put it on thicker.
customer_reviews.author: robert boyd

customer_reviews.title: Cannot return FYI
customer_reviews.text: On my garage shelf and where it will stay. Buyer beware if you need to return (no return). It said in the fine print not to use on the surface I needed so I could not use or return.
customer_reviews.author: L. Jones

customer_reviews.title: The two parts never turn clear when mixed.
customer_reviews.text: I bought the 1 gallon bottles of the same product from Amazon previously and it is worked beautifully. I ordered before I ran out so I just began using the new half gallon size bottles today. I have mixed three small batches, and all three are very cloudy and will not become clear when mixed. Unfortunately I am just outside my window to return this product. I’m hoping you can do something to help me. (I did not want to run out and I never know exactly how much I’m going to need for the projects that I’m doing.)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just as promised
customer_reviews.text: Clear directions came with the product and it was easy to both mix and spread! Some suggestions: 1) Reserve a half-cup of each part just in case you need touch-up 2) Do NOT mix/pour without a heat gun (or blow dryer?) to remove bubbles 3) The tape barrier trick around edges works well, but it may leak through in some places and also leaves a "sharp edge" that needs to be sanded/buffed down.
customer_reviews.author: jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Amateurs can use this with ease!!!
customer_reviews.text: I am by no means a professional carpenter artist or ANYTHING like that lol. I have to say this stuff is amazing if you follow the step by step directions!!! Oh and the directions are EASY to follow! I did use a second coat after the first dried and NOTE: a little bit goes a long way!
customer_reviews.author: chrissy

customer_reviews.title: Does not self level, turns yellow on white!
customer_reviews.text: I make tumblers and I'm very disappointed with this particular epoxy as it did not selflevel. My cups ended up with ripples. Also it turned a white baseball cup into a white baseball cup with yellow splotches.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The area where this product is going to be used must be 100% level.
customer_reviews.text: The order I made at Amazon was left outside at a cold temperature and I had problems. I bought it in another business and used it and the results were very good. I had never counted the cabinets. My personal opinion has to be 100% level. If this is not the case, you will have problems. This epoxy is very good. It releases the air. Very good level. It is bright and clean. I recommend everything went well.
customer_reviews.author: Juan Silva

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed!
customer_reviews.text: Worked out perfect for the projects we had! We finished a small project and next will be our coffee table!
customer_reviews.author: Josie Quintero

customer_reviews.title: Mix well for 5 mims. like the direction tell you.
customer_reviews.text: I have us this type of product for 30+ years and this is probable the best I have used. The air bubbles come out with a heat gun real easy.
customer_reviews.author: T Tice

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Pic is after 1st layer, 2nd layer looks even better. Bought this to seal my 6' table i built. Easy to work with, very little bubbles but easily removed with a heat gun. Will definitely be repurchase for my next table project
customer_reviews.author: Anna W.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product, easy to use. Used a lot more than I thought I would to fill to the top. Wanted to cork my end tables for a long time and finally got it done.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle Byrum

customer_reviews.title: First time using resin and the product was excellent and easy to work with.
customer_reviews.text: It was my first time working with epoxy resin pours. This product produced a perfectly clear glass like finish. it was easy to use, and cured fast. I would definitely recommend this for a finishing surface for a tabletop.
customer_reviews.author: Nate

customer_reviews.title: Great stuff.
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to work with. I used scoops from a bulk sport drink powder and they worked great for the amount I needed each time. I found that when the cloudiness was gone when mixing it was pretty much ready. Stir together but dont roll it into itself. That causes bubbles. Applied easily Update. When doing this table is stirred a little vigorously to be certain of a good mix. Lots of bubbles but they disappeared as I waved my cheap burnzomatic torch over the surface.
customer_reviews.author: Snb

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!! Highly recommented!!!
customer_reviews.text: Recently I decided to build another work bench in the basement and wanted to do an epoxy top. I found the Incredible Solutions clear table top epoxy and decided to give it a try. I am so happy with the results! I embedded the diagram shown (exploded in blueprint-like format) in the epoxy and was amazed at the end product!! Incredible Solutions included clear and detailed instructions on how to properly apply the epoxy. Being a first-time experience, I found I had several questions about details specific to this project, and I found their customer service (thanks Charlie) to be first rate!
customer_reviews.author: Tbonz

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality product.
customer_reviews.text: I have used other products like this one and I’m very familiar with the use and directions on how to apply it. However this item may have been stored improperly or just out dated because the flow was very thick and did not cover the surface easily without force of hand even though the surface had been probably prepped leaving pitted areas. Very unhappy☹️
customer_reviews.author: Michael & Eva Harper

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I’m not a crafty person and this was my first time project but I think it turn out ok some bumps but I know what not to do the next time but I still love my countertops I’ve already had two people to ask me to do theirs but I told them I will practice on somethings first but it was easy to use
customer_reviews.author: lisa

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Coffee Bar
customer_reviews.text: I picked this product because I liked the YouTube videos that used it. I followed the instructions and it worked like a charm. It turned rather beautiful I think. I sealed the cedar with 2 coats MinWaX Sanding Sealer prior to applying the epoxy. Almost no air bubbles when I poured the epoxy. Great product. Couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald D Webb

customer_reviews.title: Epoxy is not suitable for countertops
customer_reviews.text: We used this epoxy for our concrete countertops. We mixed it as instructed. The epoxy is to soft it will leave indents if you set a cup of coffee on it. Possibly mixing more hardener may solve this problem, but it would also reduce the time you have to work with it. The countertop also stains very easily. Mustard on the counter for less than 5 minutes stained and had to be sanded out. Koolaid on the counter stained. This product may work great for some projects, but I would NOT recommend it for a countertop or tabletop application.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Strong

customer_reviews.title: Great results.
customer_reviews.text: Took an old cheap slice of pine threw in a couple bow ties then used the Epoxy to top it off. Gave it a great finish and what was a product experiment turned into a nice side stand for the den. Happy with the results used it on a walnut sofa bar. Results even better. NOTE: follow instructions to the tee, mixing, temp, etc.. and you can get great results. Love the 50-50 mixing ratio makes it a lot easier. Already have some for the next project. Would definitely recommend..
customer_reviews.author: DLR

customer_reviews.title: Your product sucks
customer_reviews.text: Absolute garbage. Used this to adhere and lay over a carbon fiber hood. Followed all instructions and methods for this specific material. Then laid 3 coats of clear on top of it. One day in the sun and the resin separated from the hood under the carbon fiber causing huge raised bubbles. this isn’t even close to Being a good product to use. If if your project is inside and never will get 90 degrees plus in sunlight then might be fine but better keep in doors and not expect good adhesión regardless.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Spratt

customer_reviews.title: Love Pro Marine Epoxy
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and get great results if you follow the instructions; make sure your room is warm enough (75-85 degrees) and that it is CLEAN, DUST FREE. I check on my pours every 15 minutes for at least 2 1/2 hours to get any air bubbles with a torch that may decide to pop up. Eye Candy Pigments are awesome addition to add depth and color.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce E.

customer_reviews.title: Not UV resistant
customer_reviews.text: This is not a UV resistant epoxy. I did a table top about 2 months ago. A few weeks ago I noticed a yellow ting but was unsure it it was a shadow or not at first. Since then, it has gotten worse and is definitely yellowing quickly. It is indoors and not in direct sunlight. 2 months is a very short time for it to already be yellowing. This product will be fine if sealing wood or other dark materials, but I would not recommend for use on clear or light colored projects.
customer_reviews.author: Cecilia

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Looks good
customer_reviews.text: This epoxy was easy to use and looks great. I used a mapp gas torch to pop any bubbles that appeared and 3 thin coats of epoxy. The only down side is the border of my desk was a carbon fiber vinyl wrap and after the epoxy was applied it washed out the carbon fiber design and looks gloss black it still looks good, but I'm a little disappointed. My last project was a tool box top that I used and abused for over 10 years and it still looks pretty good. I don't remember the brand of the epoxy used , but if this holds up as good as that did I will be happy.
customer_reviews.author: S. Nickel

customer_reviews.title: Follow manufacturers instructions. And it will turn out
customer_reviews.text: I have never done anything like this before. I use this epoxy for a glass countertop. Wasn’t sure how it was going to even turn out. Excellent product. They said there would be bubbles and there was but when I poured it on the counter there rose to the top and popped. There were a few left that I got rid of with a toothpick and heat gun. Just follow the directions and you will be satisfied!
customer_reviews.author: Dale chiarelli

customer_reviews.title: Dangit the caps are stripped!
customer_reviews.text: I used about 2/3 of this resin and now the cap is stripped on both bottles. I needed to mix up a little bit and cant get them open. Gonna have to make a special trip to go get some from a craft store. What a waste!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Great expo you resin.
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Easy to mix and spreads like a dream. Sets up quickly and cures super hard and perfectly clear.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: Use more than you think
customer_reviews.text: Using the Gianni counter painting system we took this AWFUL dark mauve tile to look like granite! It was reccomended to use an epoxy. Used this system. Loved it. Learned that we should poor more than we did for a smoother application. A heat gun helped to fix the bubbles and divots. Measuring cup and squeegee from the dollar tree. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Getting Crafty and Reading Love

customer_reviews.title: If you haven't tried this easy to use Epoxy Resin please do it's amazing
customer_reviews.text: I love this product, the instructions were easy to follow. First I got. Two 2gallon bottles to cover my inside rocks then I purchased two 1/2gallons to cover the entire table and I am in love with it. Trying to figure out what to epoxy next😁
customer_reviews.author: Felicea Dickson

customer_reviews.title: BEST PRODUCT AND CUSTOMER SERVICE
customer_reviews.text: We made a drink rail that is 38 feet long. It turned out gorgeous, what a great product! We emailed incredible solutions several times because we didn’t want to mess up on such a large wall. They answered our questions right away. They explained how to use the product, gave us tips, and helped us create a masterpiece!
customer_reviews.author: FlashySmile

customer_reviews.title: Buy it
customer_reviews.text: Product worked great. Had to sand and put second coat on but that was my fault. I forgot to cover with screen and a Miller landed on it. It was for the best because a second coat made it look much better. Be sure to cover right away. 320 grit works good if you want to add more, and be sure to sand every square inch or it won’t bond.
customer_reviews.author: Truck upfitter

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money on this
customer_reviews.text: This product is terrible. DO NOT BUY. You HAVE to have a heat gun to use it. It completely ruined my table. A thick foam formed in the middle of the table. When I reached out about the bad product quality they told me to completely strip the resin out (requiring yet another tool a beginner wouldn’t have and to buy more of their bad product). I would not recommend this at all.
customer_reviews.author: Angie

customer_reviews.title: Read closely precautions
customer_reviews.text: This product comes with a warning label that reads highly toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects. Before purchasing I didn't realize this stuff would be that bad. They will not allow me to return it to them because it's to dangerous a product to return
customer_reviews.author: Jeremiah Hammerl

customer_reviews.title: Have fun
customer_reviews.text: Completed 2 workbench countertops. A little nervous mixing and matching the colors but fun. Glad I primed the tops first. Next time I will pay more attention to sanding before epoxy. Some minor imperfections. I will attach some pictures. These are my first attempt. Can’t wait for the next.
customer_reviews.author: Gordie

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Product was super easy to use. Just follow the instructions. This was my first resin project so I had a couple of questions. The customer service was super responsive and friendly. Great product! Great company! Will buy again! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Trish Fratarcangelo

customer_reviews.title: Will purchase again
customer_reviews.text: Great resin for a decent price, the only thing i would say is it’s not the best for coasters and it can harden quicker than most epoxy brands but it does a great job.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Allison

customer_reviews.title: It's the only one for me
customer_reviews.text: I've tried expensive resins and inexpensive ones and finally found the perfect one. The price is right and decent work time, depending on room temperature, average 30 minutes. Beautifully crystal clear, shiny and durable. I've used it on acrylic pour paintings and resin projects. It's the only one for me.
customer_reviews.author: Stef

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I didn't try to remove it so can't comment on that. Product seems good however had questions contacted them via FB and never got a response! So product might be good but, support sucks! Next order I'll try another brand and try their support first before ordering again. I got two gallons of this stuff so it'll be awhile. Happy crafting!!!! Stay safe!!!
customer_reviews.author: Opaldude

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Always wanted to do this but a little nervous, Watched a YouTube video and felt pretty confident... Very very simple and workable product ,I loved using the heat gun on it and watching it come to life and look like pure glass....Totally recommended Table top Epoxy even for the 1st timers........Thanks Incredible Solutions for making a Awesome product.....
customer_reviews.author: johnsvettes

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product!
customer_reviews.text: So far amazing product! Easy directions and easy to mix full gallon by hand with paint stirrer. Was messy and definitrly recommend drop cloths. Does seem to come off hardwood with a razor ok. Used this for a DIY laminate countertop project.
customer_reviews.author: Miranda

customer_reviews.title: Worked as expected
customer_reviews.text: What I found with this brand is to not pour more than 1/4" at a time, and hit the bubbles by waving a blow torch over very fast at 2-4 inches high. Very fast. Dried with no bubbles or cracks. For pot, I only did one half of a solo cup at time for filling old barn wood, and only had one pot get hot on me because I was slow.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Helms

customer_reviews.title: Customer Service is TOP NOTCH!
customer_reviews.text: I have used small amounts of epoxy resin before, but nothing on this scale. It was my first time pouring over steel and I had a chunk of change invested in the custom cut letters. I was nervous about getting everything sealed properly before doing my fill pours. Charlie from Incredible Solutions answered about 150 questions for me, (sometimes twice). I got my seal coat pour done this morning and I'm ready to rock and roll with the rest.
customer_reviews.author: Linda S. Funcannon

customer_reviews.title: Great look for not a lot of effort!
customer_reviews.text: Used this fill over cement in DIY base for outdoor television. Has a sheer water affect when added on top of glass beads. Easy to mix and add a little something extra. Mixed in small bucket and cleaned up with rubbing alcohol. Great look for not a lot of effort. Totally recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Geter

customer_reviews.title: Great results!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. There are several YouTube videos available. Highly recommend you watch one of the videos prior to using. My countertop turned out great!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Dixon

customer_reviews.title: Glassy and Beautiful
customer_reviews.text: I followed the instructions VERY closely. It's messy to work with, but my project turned out perfectly! It was so exciting! This stuff hardens like glass!
customer_reviews.author: moviegoernotbuff

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: First time using epoxy on a table top, I dont think I'll use anything else now. Fantastic durability and ease of use, just follow the directions
customer_reviews.author: Jerry K.

customer_reviews.title: Try at your own risk.
customer_reviews.text: Impossible to get air bubbles out. After torching 3-4 times, a million air bubbles kept coming to the surface. Ending up purchasing a different company’s epoxy and had no issues with theirs. May have gotten a bad/defective batch but still sucks to spend $65 for nothing and take all the prep and time to pour with not good results.
customer_reviews.author: CP

customer_reviews.title: Its worth the time.
customer_reviews.text: I used this on wood countertop it is beautiful clear and tougher than poly.
customer_reviews.author: Gail J.

customer_reviews.title: 5 star company with a great product!
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the better resins I have purchased. 1:1 ratio has a little bit of wiggle room where if you don't use a scale for exact weight, eyeballing your measures still works great! Fantastic seller, fast response to issue with shipping. VERY TRUSTWORTHY COMPANY! The short video is of a table inset I did with different mica powders in the resin to create layers.
customer_reviews.author: Tc

customer_reviews.title: Good product. Hardened up within 24 hours and looks great.
customer_reviews.text: Watched a lot of YouTube videos and thought this was going to be easy and it was, so long as you are well prepared. The hard part is really the clean up. Product was really nice when it finally hardened.
customer_reviews.author: DadReviews

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: Love this stuff!! I’ve made over a dozen projects so far, big and small. I’m about ready to order again. It is easily mixed and gives such a beautiful clear coating!
customer_reviews.author: R. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Don’t be Deceived by Listing
customer_reviews.text: This is 1 gallon total of mix. A 1/2 of gallon of each part. While this is a good epoxy do not be deceived by the posting and check other sellers for a full gallon of each of product.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen Coble

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Use with Great Results
customer_reviews.text: I must admit that I had not done much work with epoxy on this scale (a very large desk 6' x 3') and was used to only doing small projects that were not very deep. This epoxy is so easy to use, even a novice can figure it out. Created a solid, smooth surface on my beautiful new desk!
customer_reviews.author: C. Lentz

product_meta.title: Table Top & Bar Top Epoxy Resin, Ultra Clear UV Resistant Finish, 1-Gallon Kit, Self Leveling, Perfect for DIY Epoxy Counter Tops, Tabletops & Bars (Table Top)
feature_bullets: ✔ CRYSTAL CLEAR - Our Table Top Epoxy cures ultra clear making it perfect for table tops, bar tops, and countertops
✔ UV RESISTANT - Unlike many other epoxies, our epoxy resist yellowing caused from exposure to Ultra Violet Light Sources
✔ SELF LEVELING - Bar Top Epoxy self levels on application including corners, over bar rails and edges.
✔ HIGH GLOSS DURABLE FINISH - Epoxy resin leaves durable, blemish resistant, water resistant and impact resistant coating
✔ 100% SOLIDS - Low Odor, ZERO VOC, consistent thickness, quick curing 1 to 1 mixture, 1 Gallon Kit

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
